intro: Diplora schizocarpa, commonly known as the split-fruit diplora, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture. Its flowers are typically pale yellow or greenish-white, with five petals and stamens. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release its seeds, a feature that gives it its common name.
